content.tip: Contact the owner if you need to access this map.

save_changes.success: Your changes have been saved correctly.

form.mfa_description: Add an additional layer of security to your account to protect all data you store in CARTO. If you change the actual status you will be logged out and redirected to the login page
form.delete_all: Yes, delete my account and all my data
form.email_google: Your account is linked to your Google account.

errors.change_email: You can change the email if you set a password.

email_section.title: Email settings
email_section.description: Choose what type of emails you'd like to receive.

form.read_only: Read-only access for datasets and maps
form.write_access: Write access for editing and building datasets and maps
form.name: Name
form.info_public_name: Other users would reach you by your public name
form.disqus_placeholder: If empty, it will not appear
form.disqus_notified: Be notified by new comments in your pages
form.show_banner: Show a banner in your public profile linked to your email

maki-icons.disclaimer: Maki Icons, an open source project by Mapbox

builder-activated-notification.message: CARTO Builder has been activated in your account. Learn more about it and let us know what you think or contact us. Happy mapping!

builder-onboarding.title: Welcome to Builder,
builder-onboarding.description: Discover the new and exciting analyses you can perform with location intelligence.

toolbar.title: Toolbar
toolbar.description: The toolbar provides options to access your dashboard, edit your map, and configure its settings.

configurator.title: Edit mode
configurator.description: Manage all the components of your map: add layers and widgets, import datasets, customize analyses, and change styles.

widgets.title: Widgets list
widgets.description: The widgets you add to your map appear directly on your visualization.

data-onboarding.title: Welcome to the Layers list
data-onboarding.description: Analyze, style, and enhance your data with pop-ups and legends.

layer-options.title: Layer options
layer-options.description: Layers can be renamed by double-clicking on the layer name, centered by clicking in the crosshair, and exported through their contextual menu.

data-tab.title: Data tab
data-tab.description: Style, add analysis, pop-ups, and legends to layers. To further explore your data, add widgets.

sql-editor.title: SQL View
sql-editor.description: Data layers can be edited and processed by using the SQL view at the bottom of the screen.

add-geometry.title: Add geometries and switch to dataset view
add-geometry.description: You can switch between map or data view. In map view, you can add points, lines, and polygons.

analysis-onboarding.title: The Art of Analysis
analysis-onboarding.description: Build reproducible workflows for analyzing and explaining your data. Analyses turn your maps into Location Intelligence apps.

description-list.item2: Analyses are dynamic. When the data changes, the analysis is refreshed.
description-list.item3: The original data is not modified by the analysis workflow.
description-list.item4: Some analysis queries add calculated results to columns in your dataset.

style-onboarding.title: Style this map!
style-onboarding.description: Apply aggregation styling to maps and define options by geometry attributes or by a column value.

aggregation.title: How would you like to aggregate your data?
aggregation.description: Map types are called "Aggregation". Add Torque, Heatmap, and other aggregation styles to data.

style.title: Make it beautiful!
style.description: Use these options to style your data in beautiful ways. For example, you can create thematic maps by altering the FILL option by value.
style.short-description: Use these options to style your data in beautiful ways.

cartocss.title: Dress it up with CartoCSS
cartocss.description: Further style data by using the CartoCSS view at the bottom of the screen.

analyses-onboarding.geometries-updated: The geometries in your table were updated
analyses-onboarding.new-column-added: A new column has been added to your dataset.
analyses-onboarding.new-columns-created: New columns have been created as a new dataset.
analyses-onboarding.new-column-included: A new column has been included with your original data.
analyses-onboarding.new-columns-included: New columns has been included with your original data.
analyses-onboarding.new-columns-included-based-on-input: New columns have been included with your original data based on the columns chosen for the input.

sampling.title: Subsample Percent of Rows
sampling.description: A sample of your original table was randomly selected to give approximately a percentage of the rows from your base dataset.

merge.title: Add Columns from Second Dataset
merge.description: This analysis performed a columnar JOIN in order to get columns from two different tables.

intersection.title: Select Points in Polygons
intersection.description: This analysis performs a spatial intersection, returning only the rows from the target layer which intersect with geometries in the base layer.
intersection.source-cartodb-id: This number represents the cartodb_id of the base geometry.

area-of-influence.title: Create Travel or Distance Buffers
area-of-influence.description: Create Travel or Distance Buffers creates polygons according to the parameters set by the user.
area-of-influence.the-geom: This column was updated to show the travel or distance buffers requested.

aggregate-intersection.title: Intersect and Aggregate
aggregate-intersection.description: This operation performs a spatial intersection and aggregates the geometry values from the target layer that intersect with the geometry of the base layer.
aggregate-intersection.count-vals-density: This column is added if COUNT was chosen as the aggregation operation.
aggregate-intersection.extra-column: This column is added if {operation_type} is chosen with column {column_name}.

filter.title: Filter by Column Value
filter.description: Filter by Column Value allows you to quickly narrow down the total data you display on a map or input into an analysis node.

filter-by-node-column.title: Link Second Layer
filter-by-node-column.description: Link Second Layer allows you to filter the data in your layer by propagating the filters in the target layer. Now if you filter on widgets added to the first node, the results in the second node would be also filtered.

spatial-markov-trend.title: Predict Trends and Volatility
spatial-markov-trend.trend: The normalized trend for each geometry.
spatial-markov-trend.trend_up: The probability that a geometry's value will move to a higher class.
spatial-markov-trend.trend_down: The probability that a geometry's value will move to a lower class.
spatial-markov-trend.volatility: A measure of the potential for a geometry to possess values in other classes.
spatial-markov-trend.description: Trends and volatility are calculated based on the time series data input. Trends calculated from inputs with a longer history are more precise. Inputs for the time column should equally spaced (e.g., all one week/month/year apart).

moran.title: Detect Outliers and Clusters
moran.description: Detect Outliers and Clusters finds areas in your data where clusters of high values or low values exist, as well as areas which are dissimilar from their neighbors.
moran.quads: Classification of the geometry from the analysis.
moran.significance: The statistical significance of the geometry's classification of one of four quadrant types.
moran.moran: The local statistic calculated from the Moran's I analysis for each geometry/value in the dataset.
moran.vals: Value used in analysis. If a denominator is entered, this is the 'standardized' rate (centered on mean, normalized by standard deviation).

kmeans.title: Calculate Clusters of Points
kmeans.cluster-no: A numeric identifier for each cluster in your dataset. Values start at 1 and go up to the %{clusters} clusters you requested (or max rows if less).
kmeans.description: Point clustering uses k-means to calculate a predefined number of clusters from your data.

connect-with-lines.title: Create Lines from Points
connect-with-lines.description: Create Lines from Points using a single point, column values, or a second layer.
connect-with-lines.the-geom: This column was updated to be lines according to the method chosen.
connect-with-lines.line-sequential: This analysis creates a line by connecting all points in the dataset in a specified order.
connect-with-lines.line-source-to-target: Link a source point to a target point based on a shared attribute.
connect-with-lines.line-to-single-point: Connect the coordinate from latitude and longitude columns to the point geometry (`the_geom`) in your dataset.

group-points.title: Create Polygons from Points
group-points.the-geom: This column was updated to polygons encompassing the base points.
group-points.category: This will be the category over which the polygons were calculated.
group-points.description: Group points into polygons to create new polygons.

georeference.title: Geocode
georeference.the-geom: This column, which stores the geographic information in your dataset, has been updated to reflect the boundaries or locations from the inputs specified.
georeference.description: Geocoding data is a service that uses information from many sources to get the geographical information associated with latitude/longitude columns, city names, postal codes, administrative boundaries, IP addresses, or street addresses.

centroid.title: Create Centroids of Geometries
centroid.description: Centroids are calculated from all, groups, or singular geometries. Using the optional parameters of Categorize, Weight, and Operation, you can change how they are calculated and what information the result will contain.
centroid.the-geom: Point geometries representing the centroid(s) of your base layer.
centroid.aggregated-value: Stores the aggregate value for each centroid.
centroid.non-aggregated-value: Contains the count of features considered for each centroid.
centroid.category: Stores the category value for each centroid from the base layer.

closest.title: Find Nearest
closest.description: Select points from second dataset nearest to the geometries in current layer.
closest.source_cdb_id: This column has been created with the related points id from the base layer.
closest.the-geom: This column has been updated with the target table geometries.

timezones.amsterdam-berlin-bern-rome-stockholm-vie: Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna
timezones.helsinki-kiev-riga-sofia-tallinn-vilnius: Helsinki, Kiev, Riga, Sofia, Tallinn, Vilnius
timezones.beijing-chongqing-hong-kong-sar-urumqi: Beijing, Chongqing, Hong Kong SAR, Urumqi

upload-model.file-extension: Unfortunately, this file extension is not allowed

upload-model.url-invalid: Unfortunately, the URL provided is not valid
upload-model.connection-error: Unfortunately, there was a connection error

validation.invalid-enum: Invalid value, must be any of %{expectedValues}

geocoding-error-details.description: There was a problem geocoding your data
geocoding-error-details.title: Geocoding Error
geocoding-error-details.try-again: Please try again and if the problem persists, contact us with your username and the following code:

geocoding-success-detail.credits-consumed: You have consumed all your credits during this billing cycle, price is $%{price} / 1,000 extra credits.
geocoding-success-detail.description: We've successfully geocoded <%- realRowsFormatted %> <%- geometryType %> of <%- processableRowsFormatted %>. |||| We've successfully geocoded <%- realRowsFormatted %> <%- geometryType %>s of <%- processableRowsFormatted %>.
geocoding-success-detail.explanation: Rows that are not geocoded could have errors in their column values, or don’t exist in our data. Try geocoding again and check the 'override all values' to try again.
geocoding-success-detail.no-extra-charge: No extra charges have been done
geocoding-success-detail.remainingQuotaFormatted: You still have %{remainingQuotaFormatted} credits left for this month.
geocoding-success-detail.title: Data geocoded
geocoding-success-detail.try-again: Unsuccessful rows don't count against your quota, so we encourage you to take a look and try again.

geocoding-no-result-details.description: These rows contained empty values or perhaps we just didn't know what the values meant. We encourage you to take a look and try again.
geocoding-no-result-details.title: No rows were geocoded

warnings-details.find-connected-datasets: You can find all the connected datasets under the datasets section.
warnings-details.no-more-datasets: No more than %{maxTablesPerImport} datasets can be imported from a single file.
warnings-details.unable-to-import-datasets: Unable to import all datasets in file

partial-import-details.find-connected-datasets: You can find all the connected datasets under the datasets section.
partial-import-details.too-many-datasets: NOTE: The file you uploaded contained too many datasets. No more than %{maxTablesPerImport} datasets can be imported from a single file.
partial-import-details.unable-to-import-as-layers: Unable to add all imported datasets as layers
partial-import-details.upgrade-your-account: Upgrade your account to add more than %{userMaxLayers} layers to your maps.

connector-warning-details.too-many-rows: You may have reached the maximum limit.
connector-warning-details.unable-to-import-all-rows: For a database connector import, the number of rows allowed is %{maxRowsPerConnectorImport}. Some of your data may not be imported.

error-details.check-url: Check that the URL you provided is OK
error-details.dont-panic: Don’t panic, here's some info that might help
error-details.remote-server-code: The remote server returned a %{httpResponseCode} code.
error-details.send-us-the-error-code: Persisting error? Please send us your username and the following code

organization.title: Default settings for your Organization
organization.desc: New users will have this permission

assets-picker.error-desc: Please, go back and try again. If the problem persists contact us at support@carto.com
assets-picker.incorrect-url: Error. Your URL doesn’t look correct.
assets-picker.upload-desc: Paste a URL or select a file like JPG, GIF, PNG, SVG
assets-picker.upload-file-url: Upload a file or a URL

add-asset.modal-desc: or just use our nice selection

add-analysis.modal-desc: Select the analysis you want to add
add-analysis.disabled-option-desc: Your layer's geometries are %{simpleGeometryType} and this analysis needs %{requiredInputGeometries}.

connect-with-lines.title: Create Lines from Points
connect-with-lines.desc: Create lines from points using a single point, column values, or a second layer.

group-points.title: Create Polygons from Points
group-points.desc: Create polygons from points using convex hulls, concave hulls, bounding circles or bounding boxes.

aggregate-intersection.title: Intersect and Aggregate
aggregate-intersection.desc: Find overlapping geometries from a second layer and aggregate its values in the current layer.

area-of-influence.title: Create Travel/Distance Buffers
area-of-influence.desc: Use travel time or distance to create buffers around a point or polygon.

georeference.title: Geocode
georeference.desc: Use street addresses, city names, or other location text to create point geometries.

filter-intersection.title: Select Points in Polygons
filter-intersection.desc: Select points from a second dataset that intersect the current polygon layer.

filter.title: Filter by Column Value
filter.desc: Keep or discard rows with a selected column value.

merge.title: Add Columns from 2nd Dataset
merge.desc: Join a second dataset to current layer using a shared column value.

moran-cluster.title: Detect Outliers and Clusters
moran-cluster.desc: Use Moran's I to select geometries where values are spatially clustered and adjacent outliers.

kmeans.title: Calculate Clusters of Points
kmeans.desc: Augment with cluster_no column to spatially separate points into a specified number of groups.

centroid.title: Create Centroids of Geometries
centroid.desc: Create a direct or weighted centroid grouped by all rows or by categories from current layer.

filter-by-node-column.title: Link Second Layer
filter-by-node-column.desc: Use a shared column to link layers so second layer's widgets filter both.

sampling.title: Subsample Percent of Rows
sampling.desc: Subsample the rows in a dataset based on a specified percent.

spatial-markov-trend.title: Predict Trends and Volatility
spatial-markov-trend.desc: Predict probability of trends from a sequence of data across columns, using spatial Markov chains.

add-widgets.modal-desc: Select the widgets you want to add
add-widgets.time-series-no-option-desc: This option won't show your time-series widget

add-layer.modal-desc: Select an existing dataset or connect a new one
